items.title: Ola Electric faces insolvency petition over payment dispute
items.summary:
- Rosmerta Digital Services has filed a petition to the NCLT for insolvency proceedings against Ola Electric Technologies for alleged payment defaults.
- The petition was submitted under Section 9 of the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code, 2016.
- Ola Electric Technologies is contesting the claims and plans to take necessary steps to defend its position.
- The issue arises amid ongoing negotiations between Ola Electric and Rosmerta Digital Services and Shimnit India, impacting vehicle registration processes.
- In February, Ola Electric's vehicle registrations dropped over 65% to 8,390 units, although they claimed sales were over 25,000 units during the same period.

items.title: JioStar to remove content from YouTube
items.summary:
- JioStar, a joint venture of Reliance Industries, Viacom18, and The Walt Disney Company, is considering removing entertainment content from YouTube starting May 1.
- The decision is aimed at limiting subscriber migration from traditional television to free online platforms, but it has not been finalized.
- JioStar recently launched JioHotstar, merging content from JioCinema and Disney+ Hotstar, placing certain content behind a paywall.

items.title: Buy, sell, and pay: 5 insights into SEA’s payments landscape
items.summary:
- Digital payments in Southeast Asia are increasingly popular, with only 13% of ecommerce payments made through non-digital methods in 2023, projected to drop to 6% by 2028.
- Southeast Asia's ecommerce market was valued at US$137 billion in 2023, expected to reach US$325 billion by 2028, with cross-border ecommerce growing significantly.
- New payment methods, such as digital wallets, enhance user experience and security but introduce complexities in handling cross-border transactions.

items.title: Glasswall: The things anonymous founders say about VCs
items.summary:
- Tech in Asia launched Glasswall to help startup founders make informed decisions regarding VC investors.
- The platform allows founders to anonymously share reviews about VCs to encourage candid feedback.
- Reviews from founders are vital for Glasswall's effectiveness, and a list of active investors in Southeast Asia is provided for feedback submission.

items.title: India plans $1b fund to support digital creators: minister
items.author: Ashwini Vaishnaw
items.summary:
- The Indian government plans to establish a US$1 billion fund to support the creator economy.
- Union Information and Broadcasting Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw announced this during a press briefing for the upcoming WAVES 2025.
- The fund aims to provide digital content creators with access to capital to improve skills, enhance production quality, and expand global outreach.

items.title: Baidu launches two new AI models for text, reasoning tasks
items.summary:
- Baidu has introduced two new foundation models, Ernie 4.5 and Ernie X1.
- The models are available for free on the Ernie Bot platform since March 16.
- Ernie 4.5 is a multimodal model capable of processing text, images, audio, and video with enhanced logical reasoning and coding abilities.
- Ernie X1 is focused on deep reasoning tasks like advanced search and logical analysis, and it supports AI image generation.

items.title: B2B digital asset platform BetterX raises $1.5m pre-series A
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- BetterX raised S$2 million (US$1.5 million) in a pre-series A funding round.
- Investors include Aura Group, Kinsey Cotton, Grand Prix Capital, Aument Capital, and several angel investors.
- BetterX plans to use the funds for expansion in Asia and is exploring markets in the Middle East and the U.S.
- The company focuses on security, custody, and compliance solutions for digital assets.

items.title: Y Combinator demo day highlights AI boom, startup growth
items.summary:
- Y Combinator's annual demo day showcased early-stage startups pitching to investors in San Francisco.
- Approximately 80% of the startups focused on AI, while others showcased robotics and semiconductors.
- YC CEO Garry Tan reported an aggregate growth rate of 10% weekly for this batch of startups.
- Some startups are generating up to $10 million in revenue with fewer than ten employees due to AI-driven automation.
- 25% of startups reported that 95% of their code was AI-generated, leading to resource savings.
- This year's demo day prioritized startups with commercial traction and emphasized investor verification of claims by contacting customers.
- Founded in 2005, Y Combinator has funded over 5,300 startups with a total valuation exceeding $800 billion.

items.title: Temu’s logistics power play puts Shein on the defensive in the US
items.summary:
- US de minimis exemption currently allows goods under US$800 to enter duty-free but may be shut down, affecting Chinese ecommerce like Shein and Temu.
- Shein's reliance on direct shipments from China faces challenges with potential import tariffs, necessitating a shift in logistics strategy.
- Temu's semi-consignment model insulates it from disruptions; it has been crucial in positioning Temu for future compliance and logistic efficiency.
- In 2023, Temu achieved over US$18 billion in gross merchandise value (GMV) and continued strong growth into 2024 with US$20 billion in the first half alone.
- Temu's model reduces logistics costs and allows for faster shipping times and improved inventory management compared to Shein's direct shipping approach.

items.title: Tracking startup closures across Southeast Asia
items.summary:
- About 90% of startups worldwide fail, with two-thirds not providing positive returns to investors.
- Southeast Asia lacks comprehensive data on startup failure rates; isolated figures make it challenging to understand trends.
- Key causes of failure include inability to raise capital, lack of market need, and competition, as highlighted by various studies.
- Early-stage companies are more unstable, showing different failure rates compared to larger firms.
- This article aims to provide a macro-level overview of startup failure trends in Southeast Asia.

items.title: Balancing the scales on Peak XV
items.author: Collin Furtado
items.summary:
- Peak XV, spun off from Sequoia Capital in June 2023, has faced significant leadership departures within 18 months.
- The firm reduced its latest fund size by 16% and cut fees amid portfolio companies facing challenges.
- Notably, many departing executives received funding from Peak XV, suggesting amicable separations.
- The VC firm is shifting focus towards the US and forming teams in the country, welcoming Y Combinator's Arnav Sahu as a partner.
- In Southeast Asia, Peak XV is now investing in companies targeting global markets, scaling back focus on the region, particularly Indonesia.

items.title: Series SEA: Who’s investing in the region’s AI startups?
items.summary:
- The article analyzes investor activity in Southeast Asia’s AI startup scene over the past two years.
- It highlights a list of active investors arranged by the number of deals made in the region.
- The focus is on firms that have invested in three or more companies within the timeframe specified.
- The data is continually updated and aims to depict the impact of each firm in the investment landscape.

items.title: Goldman Sachs notes crypto for first time in shareholder letter
items.summary:
- Goldman Sachs addressed cryptocurrencies in its 2024 shareholder letter for the first time, recognizing their growing presence in financial markets.
- The firm noted increased competition in crypto-related financial products and the risks tied to digital assets, including cybersecurity threats and market volatility.
- Goldman has explored blockchain technologies, launching a crypto trading desk in 2021 and a Digital Asset Platform in 2022, while increasing its holdings in major spot bitcoin ETFs.

items.title: HK-based crypto platform RedotPay bags $40m series A
items.summary:
- RedotPay, a Hong Kong-based crypto payment platform, raised US$40 million in a series A funding round led by Lightspeed.
- Investors include Galaxy Ventures, HSG, DST Global Partners, Accel, and Vertex Ventures.
- The funding round was announced on March 14, 2023.
- Founded in 2023, RedotPay has over 3 million users worldwide.
- The funds will integrate cryptocurrency payments into everyday transactions, positioning RedotPay as a competitor to Revolut and PayPal.

items.title: Israeli genAI-focused startup Bria nets $40m series B
items.summary:
- Israeli startup Bria raised $40 million in its Series B funding round.
- The funding will be used to enhance its AI-based solutions.
- This investment highlights the growing interest in genAI technologies in the startup ecosystem.

items.title: OpenAI, Google push for AI fair use as lawsuits grow
items.summary:
- OpenAI and Google urge the US government for fair use in AI training on copyrighted content.
- OpenAI argues restricting access may affect national security, giving an advantage to countries like China.
- Google highlights the need for copyright exceptions crucial for AI innovation.
- Multiple lawsuits from creators, including Sarah Silverman and George R.R. Martin, against OpenAI and Google for alleged misuse of copyrighted data.
- Other companies like Apple and Nvidia also face accusations regarding the improper use of YouTube subtitles for AI training.

items.title: Indian supply chain firm Zetwerk eyes IPO in 24 months, CEO says
items.author: Amrit Acharya
items.summary:
- Zetwerk plans to go public within 15 to 24 months.
- Recently opened its seventh facility in India on Mar. 15, aimed at becoming an export hub, especially targeting the US market.
- Electronics manufacturing now contributes 15% to Zetwerk's revenue.
- For the fiscal year ending March 2024, sales rose 26% to 144.36 billion rupees, while net losses increased to 9.19 billion rupees from 1.09 billion rupees the previous year.
- CEO Amrit Acharya highlighted a shift of global production to India due to geopolitical tensions.
- In 2024, Zetwerk raised US$90 million, reaching a valuation of US$3.1 billion, focusing on further investments in electronics.

items.title: TSMC hits 67.1% market share as Samsung sales decline: report
items.summary:
- TSMC achieved a 67.1% market share in Q4 2024, up from 64.7% in Q3 2024.
- TSMC's sales reached US$26.85 billion, a 14.1% increase, driven by smartphone and AI demand.
- Samsung's market share fell from 9.1% to 8.1%, with sales declining 1.4% to US$3.26 billion due to lost orders.

items.title: Trump’s AI adviser divests $200m crypto ahead of new role
items.summary:
- David Sacks divested over US$200 million in digital assets before becoming an adviser to Donald Trump on AI and cryptocurrencies.
- He sold all liquid cryptocurrency holdings, including bitcoin, ethereum, and solana, as confirmed by a White House memo on Mar. 5.
- Sacks also exited stocks in Coinbase and Robinhood and crypto funds like Multicoin Capital and Blockchain Capital.
- At least US$85 million of the divested assets belonged directly to Sacks, who incurred significant tax costs.
- Despite the divestments, Sacks retains financial interests in certain illiquid digital asset firms via Craft Ventures.
- These disclosures allow him to serve as Trump’s adviser while chairing the Working Group on Digital Asset Markets.

items.title: MENA startups secured $494m in Feb, up 371% from Jan: report
items.summary:
- MENA startup ecosystem raised US$494 million across 58 deals in February 2025.
- This marks a 371% increase from January and nearly a fivefold rise from last year.
- Debt financing dropped to only 15% of total investment, down from 90% in January.
- Saudi Arabia led with US$250.3 million from 25 deals; UAE followed with US$203.5 million from 15 startups, and Egypt with US$27.5 million from 8 deals.
- Fintech secured US$274 million from 15 deals, followed by insurtech with US$55 million and logistics with US$28.5 million.
- Later-stage funding saw strong activity, with Tabby raising US$160 million in series E, while Ula and Merit Incentives raised US$28 million each in series B.
- B2B startups raised US$191.6 million, and B2C startups raised US$138.5 million.
- Male-led startups received US$429 million (87% of total funding), while female-led startups secured only US$200,000.

items.title: Capital SEA: Southeast Asia’s funding landscape
items.summary:
- An overview of the funding landscape in Southeast Asia.
- Discusses trends, key players, and investment dynamics in the region.
- Highlights the growth of tech startups and venture capital in Southeast Asia.

items.title: Apple exec calls Siri AI delays ‘ugly and embarrassing’
items.author: Robby Walker
items.summary:
- Apple is experiencing delays in AI developments, particularly with Siri updates.
- Robby Walker described the situation as "ugly and embarrassing" due to quality issues and unclear launch timelines.
- The updates intended for Siri aim to improve personal data integration and app control, currently functioning only 67% to 80% of the time.
- Aimed for an iOS 19 release next year, the timeline remains uncertain due to internal criticisms and employee burnout.
- Despite increasing competition in AI, Apple is focused on enhancing Siri's capabilities and will release updates when they meet user expectations.

items.title: Swedish BNPL firm Klarna files for US IPO
items.summary:
- Klarna has filed for an IPO to list on the NYSE under the ticker 'KLAR.'
- The company did not disclose the number of shares or price range.
- The choice of the US market over Europe reflects difficulties European exchanges face in attracting tech firms.
- Klarna's valuation decreased from US$46 billion in 2021 to US$6.7 billion in 2022 but improved with profitability in 2023.
- Revenue increased by 24% to US$2.8 billion, with an adjusted operating profit of US$181 million compared to a loss of US$49 million the previous year.
- Founded in 2005, Klarna provides BNPL services and is seeking a US banking license.
- The IPO occurs during a slow recovery for tech listings, with few significant US IPOs since 2021.
- Market factors include rising interest rates and volatility; the IPO's timing is subject to market conditions and regulatory approvals.

items.title: Fintech firm Block expands lending after stock slump
items.summary:
- Block has received approval from the FDIC to issue loans through Square Financial Services.
- The company expands its Cash App Borrow product, which offers small-dollar consumer loans.
- This expansion comes after a 33% decline in stock value this year and slowing revenue growth of just 4.5% last quarter.
- Cash App Borrow offers short-term loans averaging under US$100 with one-month repayment.
- Despite a strong underwriting model, transaction losses in the lending division rose by 39%.
- Block integrated Afterpay into the Cash App card to enhance competition in the BNPL market.

items.title: Chevron said to plan US natural gas data centers by 2028
items.author: The Business Times
items.summary:
- Chevron is reportedly planning to establish natural gas data centers in the US by 2028.
- This initiative may be part of a broader strategy to expand their operations in the renewable energy sector.
- The development aligns with global trends toward more sustainable energy solutions.

items.title: US Vice President JD Vance expects TikTok sale deal by April
items.summary:
- US Vice President JD Vance anticipates a TikTok sale agreement by April 5.
- Bipartisan legislation requires ByteDance to sell TikTok to avoid a US ban.
- Former President Trump extended the deadline to early April 2025, with negotiations ongoing with unspecified groups.
- Potential buyers include businessman Reid Rasner, with offers over $47 billion, along with Alexis Ohanian and Frank McCourt.
- Vance highlights emphasis on data privacy and national security, with negotiation details undisclosed.

items.title: These funds have not invested in SEA in the past year
items.summary:
- The article discusses funds that have not invested in Southeast Asia (SEA) tech startups over the last 12 months despite having backed companies in the region in the past two years.
- Reasons for this absence may include waiting for better investment opportunities, a shift in focus, or the market not being a priority.
- It emphasizes the importance of timing when reaching out to investors.

items.title: China cracks down on AI-driven stock market misinformation
items.summary:
- China’s securities regulator is intensifying efforts to combat stock market misinformation.
- The crackdown, coordinated with police and cyberspace authorities, targets AI-driven misleading information.
- The goal is to refute stock market rumors and improve investor education to limit false information spread.
- This announcement aligns with World Consumer Rights Day on March 15, promoting consumer protection in China.

items.title: Intel’s new CEO to get $1m salary, $66m stock grants
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Intel's new CEO, Lip-Bu Tan, will earn a $1 million salary and $66 million in stock options/grants.
- Compensation package includes $14.4 million long-term stock grants, $17 million performance-based grants, and $9.6 million in stock options.
- He will also receive a $2 million annual bonus and may get accelerated vesting in case of a change in control at Intel.
- Tan was appointed CEO after the removal of Pat Gelsinger in December 2024.
- His appointment follows a 20% rise in Intel's stock this year.
- Tan has committed to purchasing $25 million in Intel shares as part of his compensation conditions.

items.title: A busy week for M&As
items.summary:
- This week saw the highest number of M&As in Asia's tech community observed in recent times.
- Major funding deals include Zolve securing $251 million, Insilico Medicine raising $110 million, and Sola Security launching with $30 million.
- M&As included Otorio acquired by Armis for $120 million and CreditNirvana being purchased by Perfios.
- A total of 86 deals worth over $680 million were reported this week.

items.title: Japan’s top-funded tech companies in the last decade
items.summary:
- Japan boasts an innovative startup ecosystem alongside traditional tech giants like Sony and Sharp.
- The article provides a tracker for funding activities of tech firms nearing the billion-dollar mark in Japan.
- Users are encouraged to report inaccuracies and feedback via email; there is also a subscription model to access premium content.

items.title: Google seeks relaxed copyright, export rules for AI edge
items.summary:
- Google submitted a policy proposal for a national AI Action Plan, advocating relaxed copyright restrictions.
- Proposals include legal codification of fair use and exceptions for text-and-data mining for AI developers.
- Concerns raised about export controls on advanced AI chips, arguing they could hurt US competitiveness.
- Proposal includes increased investment in domestic AI research and release of government datasets for commercial use.
- Advocates for a unified federal approach to AI regulation, opposing state-level complexities and strict liability obligations for AI developers.
- Raised concerns over AI disclosure requirements in the EU affecting trade secrets and national security.

items.title: Apple’s iPhone 16 approved for sale in Indonesia
items.summary:
- Apple’s iPhone 16 lineup has been approved for sale in Indonesia by the Ministry of Communication and Digital (Komdigi) and the Ministry of Industry (Kemenperin) on Mar. 14.
- Approved models include iPhone 16, iPhone 16 Plus, iPhone 16 Pro, iPhone 16 Pro Max, and iPhone 16e, all imported from China.
- The series also received Domestic Component Level (TKDN) certification on Mar. 7, meeting key regulatory requirements.
- Apple plans to invest in Indonesia by establishing a local software research center as part of an agreement for innovation investment from 2025–2028.

items.title: Intel stock jumps 12% as new CEO takes over
items.summary:
- Intel's stock surged 12% on Mar. 13 after announcing Lip-Bu Tan as CEO, effective next week.
- Tan's appointment is aimed at helping Intel recover from year of underperformance, particularly in the AI semiconductor sector.
- Intel's stock has decreased about 60% over the past five years, while major indices have more than doubled.
- Analysts believe Tan’s industry connections could benefit Intel’s foundry business.
- Intel’s market value has fallen below $100 billion, with ongoing weak sales of Gaudi AI chips.
- Despite Tan's previous success at Cadence Design Systems, analysts caution a significant turnaround could take years.

items.title: Chinese hedge fund High-Flyer leads AI in $10t fund industry
items.summary:
- Chinese hedge fund High-Flyer is advancing AI use in China’s $10 trillion fund management sector.
- High-Flyer founded AI startup DeepSeek, enhancing its AI-driven multi-billion dollar portfolio management.
- DeepSeek’s large language model is being adopted by various financial firms, spurring AI research and recruitment.
- Shenzhen government allocates 4.5 billion yuan ($620.75 million) to support hedge funds' AI investments.
- Viewpoints shifting as AI skepticism fades; companies see AI as vital for survival and performance.

items.title: Oracle said to be in talks for cloud center in Indonesia
items.summary:
- Oracle is negotiating with the Indonesian government to set up a cloud services center on Batam Island, primarily at Nongsa Digital Park.
- Batam's advantages include data center infrastructure, free trade zone benefits, and its closeness to Singapore and Malaysia.
- Oracle has existing cloud centers in Singapore and a $6.5 billion data facility planned in Malaysia, indicating a trend of US tech giants investing in Asia for AI growth.
- Ongoing talks have not received comments from Oracle or Indonesia’s Coordinating Ministry for Economic Affairs.

items.title: Apple’s iPhone 16e faces subsidy-fueled competition
items.summary:
- Apple’s iPhone 16e sold 60% better in its first three days than the 2022 iPhone SE, according to IDC.
- Analysts expect a 2% decline in Apple’s market performance in China this year despite the initial sales success.
- Priced at US$599, the 16e competes with subsidized Android devices from brands like Xiaomi and Vivo.
- The iPhone 16e features a single rear camera and limited storage, which may hinder its success in China.
- Analysts predict the 16e could perform better in India, potentially accounting for 20% of iPhone sales by late 2025.
- Apple reported an 11% sales decline in China during the holiday season, impacting its overall performance.

items.title: A list of fundraising startups from Asia and beyond (Updated)
items.summary:
- The article lists fundraising startups for support in the fundraising process.
- Startup owners can register for listing their companies.
- Investors can opt-in for curated startup emails if they are paying subscribers.

items.title: D2C kitchenware firm Wonderchef posts $184k profit in FY24
items.summary:
- Wonderchef, a direct-to-consumer kitchenware company, reported a profit of $184,000 for the fiscal year 2024.
- The company has seen growth attributed to its focus on online sales and customer engagement strategies.
- The kitchenware market has shown resilience despite economic challenges, enhancing Wonderchef’s performance in the D2C sector.

items.title: Tesla to launch more affordable Model Y in China by 2026
items.summary:
- Tesla plans to produce a more affordable Model Y in China starting in 2026.
- Project named “E41” aims to reduce production costs by at least 20% compared to the latest Model Y.
- Current Model Y starts at 263,500 yuan (approximately US$36,351).
- Shanghai facility targets the domestic market to compete with local EV companies.
- Tesla's market share for battery-only EVs decreased from 11.7% to 10.4% between 2023 and 2024.
- Competition includes new models like Xiaomi’s SU7 and the upcoming YU7 crossover.
- No confirmed plans for North American and European production yet.
- CEO Elon Musk referenced a new car platform in 2025 without specifics on pricing or details.

items.title: QuikBot partners with SG bubble tea chain for robotic delivery
items.summary:
- PlayMade, a Singapore-based bubble tea chain, partners with QuikBot Technologies for robotic delivery pilot.
- Announcement made on Mar. 15; integration at select PlayMade outlets.
- Features automated bubble tea machine producing drinks in under eight seconds alongside QuikBot robots.
- Pilot aims to evaluate operational efficiency, delivery performance, and customer reactions.
- Key areas of evaluation include coordination with robots and customer feedback.
- The pilot operates during off-peak hours and targets high-demand periods.
- Initial orders via messaging platforms with a dedicated PlayMade app planned by Q3 2025.
- PlayMade has over 25 outlets in Singapore, founded in 2017.

items.title: Chinese AI chipmaker secures state-led funding, valued at $2.2b
items.summary:
- Chinese AI chip company Biren Technology has raised funds led by a state-owned investment fund in Shanghai.
- The company is valued at US$2.2 billion, according to the 2024 Hurun Global Unicorn List.
- The investment was secured through a private equity entity under Shanghai State-owned Capital Investment (SSCI).
- This is the first investment by an AI industry-specific “fund of funds” under SSCI’s private equity arm, aimed at supporting China’s AI chip ecosystem.
- Biren Technology competes with Nvidia and is preparing for an initial public offering in China.

items.title: Nasdaq plunges as tech stocks lose $2.7t
items.summary:
- The Nasdaq index has fallen to its lowest level since September due to a sell-off in major tech stocks.
- The largest seven US tech firms lost a total of US$2.7 trillion in market value over three weeks.
- The decline follows President Trump's announcement of high tariffs, raising concerns about a trade war and recession, particularly impacting tech companies reliant on global trade.
- Nvidia experienced the largest loss at US$577 billion, followed by Apple at US$529 billion and Microsoft at US$267 billion.
- Amazon, Alphabet, Meta, and Tesla also suffered significant losses, with Tesla dropping 33%, losing US$386 billion.
- The Nasdaq is down 4.9% for the week, potentially marking its worst performance in six months, with a risk of exceeding the 5.8% drop threshold since January 2022.
- Goldman Sachs labeled the sector as the “Maleficent 7,” warning of continued risks.

items.title: Bank of China launches $7b fund for tech startups
items.summary:
- The Bank of China has launched a 50 billion yuan (US$6.9 billion) fund for technology startups.
- This fund builds on a previous 30 billion yuan (US$4.15 billion) fund aimed at fostering innovation and supporting emerging industries.
- The initiative aligns with China’s 2025 policy priorities focused on boosting consumption amid geopolitical tensions with the US.
- The move follows a similar tech innovation fund introduced by the Industrial and Commercial Bank of China.
keywords: Industrial and Commercial Bank of China

items.title: Trump staying on track for TikTok, says US Commerce chief
items.summary:
- US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick confirms President Trump is addressing TikTok’s situation within the timeline set.
- Trump previously signed an executive order granting ByteDance, TikTok’s parent company, a 75-day extension to sell the platform due to national security concerns.
- Ongoing discussions with four groups are being held regarding a potential sale of TikTok, which is under scrutiny in the US over privacy issues related to its Chinese ownership.

items.title: CATL sees slowest profit growth, first revenue drop
items.summary:
- CATL's net profit for 2024 was 50.7 billion yuan (US$7.01 billion), a 15% increase.
- This marks the company's slowest profit growth in six years, within a forecasted range of 11.1%-20.1%.
- Annual revenue declined by 9.7% to 362 billion yuan (US$50.02 billion), the first drop since reporting began in 2015.
- Revenue drop attributed to reduced product prices despite higher sales volumes, reflecting lower raw material costs.
- The company faces challenges from a prolonged price war in China's EV market.

items.title: Digital signature firm shares jump 14% on strong Q4 earnings
items.summary:
- DocuSign shares rose over 14% after Q4 fiscal 2025 earnings exceeded analyst expectations.
- Company reported revenue of US$776 million, a 9% increase from last year.
- Subscription revenue was US$757 million, also up 9%; net income increased to US$83.5 million from US$27.24 million.
- For Q1, revenue is projected between US$745 million and US$749 million, with full-year estimates of US$3.129 billion to US$3.141 billion.
- Earnings boost attributed to the launch of DocuSign IAM, an AI platform for agreements.
- CEO Allan Thygesen anticipates IAM will contribute low double-digit growth by Q4 fiscal 2026.
- Partnerships with Microsoft and Google aim to expand services despite market challenges.

items.title: Global pitch contest opens in Hong Kong with $100m fund
Asia layoff tracker: Job cuts at Nio, Deliveroo
The Great Minimart Question
items.summary:
- Online brands in Indonesia are increasingly venturing into minimarts for greater convenience and market presence.
- Expanding to minimarts allows these brands to attract a different customer segment and tackle offline retail challenges.
- Success in offline retail requires understanding and meeting customers' needs effectively.
